definitions: flexible rubber or plastic bag filled with air or gas for decoration or play
rounded outline containing dialogue in comics or cartoons
examples: The children released colorful balloons into the sky
She blew up twenty balloons for the birthday party
The cartoon character's words appeared in a thought balloon
Draw a speech balloon around the dialogue text

definitions: structure built to commemorate a person or event of historical importance
something that serves as lasting evidence of notable achievement or period
examples: Tourists gathered around the ancient monument to take photos
The city erected a monument to honor fallen soldiers
Her research stands as a monument to scientific dedication
This building remains a monument to Victorian architecture

definitions: act of attempting to do something difficult or challenging
scoring play in rugby where player grounds ball behind opponent's goal line
examples: Give it another try before you give up completely
This was her third try at passing the exam
The player scored a brilliant try in the corner
Wales needs two more tries to win the match

definitions: signal or prompt that indicates when someone should do something specific
long tapered stick used to strike balls in billiards or pool
examples: The director gave the actor a subtle cue to enter
Wait for your cue before starting the presentation
He carefully chalked his cue before the shot
The pool cue slipped from his sweaty hands

definitions: part of garment that covers all or part of the arm
protective covering or case for storing records, documents, or devices
examples: She rolled up her sleeves to wash the dishes
The jacket has long sleeves perfect for winter
Slide the CD back into its plastic sleeve
The document was kept safe in a protective sleeve

definitions: fee charged for using a bridge, road, or highway
number of deaths, casualties, or damage resulting from disaster or conflict
examples: Drivers must pay a toll to cross the bridge
The highway toll increased by two dollars this year
The earthquake's death toll continued to rise daily
Years of stress took a heavy toll on her health

definitions: legal document authorizing police to make arrest or search property
reasonable grounds or justification for an action, belief, or feeling
examples: Police obtained a search warrant for the suspect's home
The judge issued an arrest warrant for the fugitive
Her suspicious behavior doesn't warrant such harsh treatment
The evidence warrants a thorough investigation of the case

definitions: permanent decorative design made on skin by inserting pigment with needles
military drum or bugle signal calling soldiers to return to quarters
examples: She got a small butterfly tattoo on her ankle
The tattoo artist spent three hours completing the design
The evening tattoo signaled soldiers to return to barracks
Military tattoo ceremonies feature impressive drumming displays

definitions: ceremony marking completion of academic degree or educational program
marks on measuring instrument showing units of measurement
examples: Her parents attended her graduation from medical school proudly
Graduation ceremonies will be held in the main auditorium
Check the graduation marks on the measuring cylinder carefully
The thermometer's graduation shows temperature in Celsius degrees

definitions: person from Japan or of Japanese ancestry
language spoken in Japan using hiragana, katakana, and kanji characters
examples: Many Japanese tourists visit this temple every year
The Japanese are known for their attention to detail
She's been studying Japanese for three years now
Can you translate this Japanese text into English

definitions: person killed or injured in war, accident, or disaster
hospital department dealing with emergency cases and accident victims
examples: The bombing resulted in dozens of civilian casualties
Casualty figures from the earthquake continue to rise
The patient was rushed to casualty after the accident
She works night shifts in the casualty department

definitions: elongated curved tropical fruit with soft flesh and yellow skin
source of comedic slipping accidents in slapstick humor
examples: She packed a banana for her morning snack
These bananas are perfectly ripe for eating today
The clown slipped on a banana peel for laughs
It's an old banana peel gag from silent movies

definitions: framework with bars, hooks, or pegs for holding or storing things
historical torture device that stretched victims' bodies painfully
examples: Hang your coat on the rack by the door
The bike rack outside the store was completely full
Prisoners were threatened with torture on the rack
The medieval rack was a horrific instrument of pain

definitions: way in which something is used or employed
habitual or customary practice in language or word choice
examples: Check the manual for proper usage of this tool
Heavy usage has worn out the equipment quickly
Modern English usage differs from Shakespeare's time significantly
This dictionary explains current usage of technical terms

definitions: major division of Christian Bible into Old and New sections
something that serves as evidence or proof of a specified quality
examples: She reads a chapter from the Old Testament daily
The New Testament contains the four Gospel accounts
His success is a testament to years of hard work
The building stands as a testament to architectural innovation

definitions: computer program used to view and navigate websites on the internet
person who looks at goods in stores without serious intention to buy
examples: Update your browser to view this website properly
Chrome and Firefox are popular internet browsers
Weekend browsers filled the bookstore but few bought anything
She's just a browser, not a serious customer

definitions: central computer chip that executes instructions and performs calculations
kitchen appliance that chops, blends, or mixes food ingredients
examples: This laptop has a powerful quad-core processor
The processor speed determines how fast programs run
Use the food processor to chop vegetables quickly
The processor can blend ingredients into smooth paste

definitions: part of human leg between hip and knee
examples: The athlete pulled a muscle in her right thigh
He has a large tattoo covering his entire thigh
Chicken thighs are juicier than breast meat
The nurse administered the injection in his thigh

definitions: amount of product or crop produced from cultivation or manufacturing
income return or profit generated from investment or financial asset
examples: This year's wheat yield exceeded all expectations
The farm's yield decreased due to drought conditions
Government bonds offer a steady yield for investors
The stock's dividend yield is three percent annually

definitions: act or process of speaking or having a conversation with someone
examples: The constant talking in class disrupted everyone's concentration
No talking allowed during the examination period please
Their talking continued late into the night
She did most of the talking during the meeting

definitions: person or business involved in wholesale trade or retail sales
ship used for transporting commercial cargo rather than military purposes
examples: The silk merchant traveled along ancient trade routes
Local merchants gathered at the town market square
Merchant vessels carry goods across international waters
The merchant navy played a crucial role during wartime

definitions: smallest discrete unit of energy or matter in quantum physics theory
large or significant amount or sudden dramatic increase
examples: Scientists study quantum mechanics at subatomic particle levels
A quantum of light energy is called a photon
The discovery represents a quantum leap in medical research
We need a quantum shift in our thinking

definitions: strip of hair growing above the eye on the brow ridge
examples: She raised one eyebrow in skeptical surprise
He accidentally shaved off half his eyebrow
The makeup artist carefully shaped her eyebrows
His bushy eyebrows gave him a distinguished appearance

definitions: total collection of words known and used by a person or language
specialized set of terms used in particular subject, profession, or activity
examples: Reading books helps expand your vocabulary significantly
Young children rapidly develop their vocabulary through daily conversation
Medical vocabulary can be difficult for patients to understand
The technical vocabulary in this manual requires expertise

definitions: electronic system using radio waves to detect position and movement of objects
examples: Air traffic control relies on radar to track planes
The ship's radar detected an approaching storm system
Police use radar guns to measure vehicle speeds
The stealth aircraft avoided enemy radar detection successfully

definitions: person who unlawfully and deliberately kills another human being
examples: The murderer was sentenced to life in prison
Police finally caught the serial murderer after years
The detective searched for clues to identify the murderer
In the novel, the murderer's identity shocked everyone

definitions: round flat cake of minced meat, typically beef, served in a bun
examples: He ordered a cheeseburger with extra pickles and fries
The restaurant serves the best burgers in town
She prefers veggie burgers to traditional meat ones
Grill the burger patties for five minutes each side

definitions: part of shirt or garment that fits around the neck
band worn around animal's neck for identification or control
examples: He loosened his collar in the summer heat
The shirt collar was stained with makeup
Put a collar with tags on your puppy
The dog's collar has our phone number attached

definitions: book containing comprehensive information about a subject used for studying
something that serves as a classic or perfect example of its type
examples: Students must purchase the required chemistry textbook
The professor wrote the textbook used in class
His response was a textbook example of good leadership
The operation was a textbook case of military planning

definitions: physical feeling or perception from stimulation of senses or body
widespread reaction of interest, excitement, or shock among many people
examples: She felt a tingling sensation in her fingers
The cold water created an unpleasant sensation
The scandal caused a sensation in the media
Her performance became an overnight sensation worldwide

definitions: quality of being pleasant or attractive that fascinates or delights others
small ornament worn for supposed magical protection or good luck
examples: His natural charm won over the entire audience
The old cottage has a rustic charm
She wore a lucky charm on her bracelet
The witch cast a protective charm over the house

definitions: tool with heavy head for hitting nails or breaking things
part of gun mechanism that strikes firing pin to discharge weapon
examples: Use a hammer to drive the nail into wood
The construction worker swung his hammer all day
The gun's hammer must be cocked before firing
Check if the hammer spring needs replacement

definitions: set of keys for operating computer or typewriter to input text
set of keys on piano or electronic musical instrument
examples: She types ninety words per minute on her keyboard
Spilled coffee damaged my computer keyboard yesterday
The musician played a beautiful melody on the keyboard
This keyboard has weighted keys like a real piano

definitions: cereal grain that is ground to make flour for bread and pasta
examples: Farmers harvest wheat in late summer each year
This bread is made from whole wheat flour
Wheat prices rose due to poor weather conditions
The golden wheat fields stretched for miles

definitions: animal that naturally hunts and feeds on other animals for survival
person who exploits or takes advantage of others, especially vulnerable individuals
examples: Lions are apex predators in the African savanna
The hawk circled above, a silent predator seeking prey
Online predators target children through social media platforms
Financial predators exploit elderly people's savings ruthlessly
